definition: impatient (idiom); in a hurry/itching to get on with it
to force/to compel/to approach or go towards/urgent/pressing
to wait/to treat/to deal with/to need/going to (do sth)/about to/intending to

sentences.english: I can't wait to take a bite of the pumpernickel.
sentences.chinese: 我簡直迫不及待想喫一口黑包。

sentences.english: The manufacturers in Mainland China are eager to adopt the products of Media Tek and MStar Semiconductor.
sentences.chinese: 而中國廠家則迫不及待地投入聯發科和晨星的懷抱。

sentences.english: When I saw the blue, I can not wait into the embrace of the sea.
sentences.chinese: 當看到那片蔚藍色時，我迫不及待地投入到它的懷抱。

sentences.english: "Bosses to" I can not wait to submit applications.
sentences.chinese: “老闆，來兩碗麪湯”我迫不及待的提出申請。

sentences.english: The 11-year-old boy couldn't wait to eat the roast chicken.
sentences.chinese: 那個十一歲的男孩迫不及待地喫烤雞。

sentences.english: Even the little grandchildren couldn't wait to tell Dad why they loved him.
sentences.chinese: 就連小孫子也迫不及待地要告訴爸爸他們爲什麼愛他。

sentences.english: So I feel compelled to share the benefits of being on this side.
sentences.chinese: 我迫不及待地想與你們分享這方面的好處。

sentences.english: Elizabeth and Lawrence are chomping at the bit to go on vacation.
sentences.chinese: 伊莉莎白和勞倫斯迫不及待要去度假了。

sentences.english: Just bought back, I was eager to pull dad try to square.
sentences.chinese: 剛買回來，我就迫不及待地拉着爸爸到廣場一試身手。

sentences.english: Naturally, I can't wait to see the book in print.
sentences.chinese: 自然，我迫不及待的看到我的書被印出來。

sentences.english: Then the man drove away, apparently in a great hurry.
sentences.chinese: 然後，劫車人迫不及待地急馳而去。

sentences.english: I brooked no delay in opening it.
sentences.chinese: 我迫不及待地打開信封。

sentences.english: To effect objects so dear to every patriot I shall devote myself with anxious solicitude.
sentences.chinese: 爲達成每個愛國者的宿願，我將迫不及待地全力以赴。

sentences.english: It is important for me to start the game and I am raring to go.
sentences.chinese: 這場比賽對我來說很重要，我有點迫不及待了。

sentences.english: For gifts you can't wait to give.
sentences.chinese: 你迫不及待想送出的禮物。

sentences.english: I can’t wait to worship the Lord!
sentences.chinese: 我迫不及待想朝拜上帝。

definition: to be unable to hold back
to be eager to give sth a try (idiom)
to become exhilarated (idiom); in high spirits/full of zest
fig. to rub one's fists and wipe one's palms (idiom)/to roll up one's sleeves for battle/eager to get into action or start on a task
to begin to stir (idiom)/to get restless/to become threatening
